pullRequest.body:
We add the statement that (multiplicative and additive) equivalences preserve the order of an element.

---

nodes.body: I think it is enough to assume that `e` is injective?

Good point. But I think it is still good to have the `MulEquiv` version in addition (so that one doesn't have to add `e.injective` as an additional argument. I'll add the injective version and golf the equiv one. (Also to have dot notation.)

OK, that simplifies things. (I guess I didn't think of looking for the injective version...)
I still think it's good to have an explicit `MulEuiv` version so that one can write `e.orderOf_eq m` when `e` is an equivalence.
I think it should go under the injective counter part, and maybe made a simp lemma?

Pull request successfully merged into master.
